SQL> REM * HAS TWO MEANINGS
SQL> 
SQL> REM 1 META CHARACTGER
SQL> 
SQL> REM 2 ARITHMETIC OPERATOR FOR MULTIPLICATION
SQL>

SQL> REM WHEN WE USE ONLY * IN SELECT, IT IS USED AS META CHARACTER
SQL>

SQL> REM 2 WHEN WE USE ANYTHING ELSE WITH * IN SELECT, IT IS USED AS ARITHMETIC OPERATOR.
SQL> 
SQL> SELECT ROWID , * FROM EMPLOYEES;
SELECT ROWID , * FROM EMPLOYEES
               *
ERROR at line 1:
ORA-00936: missing expression 


SQL> REM WE CAN GUIDE ORACLE TO USE * AS META CHARACTERIN TWO WAYS
SQL> 
SQL> REM 1 TABLENAME.* 2 TABLEALIS.*
SQL> 
SQL> REM WE CAN QUALIFY * IN ABOVE TWO STYLES
SQL> 
SQL> SELECT ROWID , EMPLOYEES.* FROM EMPLOYEES;
